reviews.review: Ok, I just bought this game and I have been addicted for the last day and a half. Now, I'm going to convince you to buy it. Maybe you aren't going to buy it because of the graphics , which is a fair point. The graphics on source are much better than you think they are. They are quite good and very tolerable. Maybe you think that there aren't any good servers, which is untrue. I highly suggest AWP Clan servers which are usually crowded 24/7 with people speaking fluent english. Something source has on GO is the quality of the community. Everyone is genuinely a nice person that loves the game. Don't think, just buy the game, and then return it if you don't like it.

one of the best games ive ever played 
14/10

Lots of hype, lots of things to do and kill but not my things.

I purchased this to play with some friends who are going on about how amazing this game is, and as far as FPS goes (not really a fan) I did enjoy this for a short few minutes. 

I personally get bored of the repetitve nature of FPS, join a server, go kill some stuff on some levels and then repeat. Please don't think I am insulting FPS players, just its one of those genres that doesn't really appeal to me.

However, I did find this game had a much larger selection of maps and weapons which means I will probably start playing this again at some point.

Overall I would recomend this game.
pretty nice but why does it cost more than csgo ????
This game was pinnacle point for Valve because of the source engine being developed. Was a great game.

A big improvement over CS 1.6 but with some differences in the weapons. It is still played today in community servers and the're are a lot of them. The only problem I have is the price. I mean, 20 bucks for a game released more than 10 years ago... Also CS:GO is cheaper so WTF? I recommend it anyway but only on sale.

Not as good as 1.6, but a personal opinion.  Enjoyed some of the experience, was at the time a good looking game compared to 1.6, but 1.6 was my love, it was my life at the time.  If you enjoy serious fps team based action, it is a good game.  So even thought it is not my favorite, I would recommend it to anyone interested.  Please enjoy your day, and have a pleasure spending money on this fine game.  BTW, you should prolly buy csgo, but eh, to each their own.
If you don't have this in your steam library, what are you doing on steam?

As I'm not the most competitive person, competitive games like this usually aren't my favourite. Only reason I bought this game was because I wanted to get the textures which are used in many TTT maps in Garry's Mod. But, this game is pretty easy to play and easy to understand, but for the lack of Official servers it deserves negativity on my end.

I recommend this game for people, who want to get a lot of GMod textures or to those who like playing tactical/PvP shooters

A game I owned back in 04, pirated when I got hacked and lost my account, this account is the lasted one I made and it just feels good to buy it and play again. I've played 1.6 and Source a lot when I was younger and I really wish I could put more hours into this, alas the future of Counter Strike is shaping to omething different. However when I wake up at 2 am in the morning without any sleeping. I'll get out of bed, power my pc, put on my headset and open up Counter Strike: Source. Just like when I was younger, and meet new people, play competitively, and love every bit of it. This game... aswell as 1.6 will forever hold a special place in my heart.

Death is an extremely complex theme, with a lot of meanings depending on your cultural background. But in Counter-Strike: Source, it becomes almost meaningless, and given that its objective is to loyally represent the memory of Counter-Terrorism, I'd say mission very well accomplished.
